text: Khao Yai National Park is the first national park in Thailand. It was established in 1962. It covers an area of 2,166 square kilometers. ==Location== It is located in western part of the Sankamphaeng Mountain Range in northeast Thailand. ==Wildlife== It is home to over 3,000 plant species and over 300 bird species. It has 66 species of mammals. Pythons, cobras, Asian black bears, leopard and otters are among the other animals found in Khao Yai National Park. ==References== Category:National parks Category:Thailand Category:National parks in Thailand
title: Khao Yai National Park
